properties.details: Mao Zedong was born in Shaoshan, Hunan Province, China.

properties.event: Founding of the Chinese Communist Party
properties.details: Mao Zedong was one of the founding members of the Chinese Communist Party.

properties.event: Establishment of the People's Republic of China
properties.details: Mao Zedong proclaimed the establishment of the People's Republic of China in Beijing.
Mao Zedong participated in the Nanchang Uprising, one of the early armed uprisings of the Chinese Communist Party.
Mao Zedong led the Red Army on the Long March, a military retreat undertaken by the Communist Party of China.
During the Zunyi Conference, Mao Zedong emerged as a key leader within the Chinese Communist Party.
Mao Zedong led the Communist Party's efforts in the resistance against the Japanese invasion of China.
The Yan'an Rectification Movement aimed to consolidate Mao Zedong's leadership and enforce party discipline.
Mao Zedong launched the Great Leap Forward, an economic and social campaign in China.
Mao Zedong initiated the Cultural Revolution, a socio-political movement in China.
